CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper November 19, 1955, pg. 2, reads: "Circus Time - Earl Stewart, 54-year-old artist, of 7220 Hilliards Street, observes as Mrs. Charles H. Moore, of Kentucky Avenue, Shadyside, examines Stewart's oil painting 'Circus Time,' one of twenty-two out of forty-four September entries selected to be displayed at the Gateway Branch of the Pittsburgh Plan for Art to be opened on Dec. 8 on the first floor, North Wing of Gateway Building III.  About fifty art works are to be shown in a continuous display.  Mr. Stewart has been painting for eight years, has studied at the Arts and Craft Center and exhibited in Everyman's Art Shows. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Mrs. Moore and Earl Stewart standing in front of his "Circus Time" painting, in Pittsburgh Plan for Art gallery in Gateway Building III
